title: Samsung C&T shares rise after report of planned stake purchase in biopharma affiliate
text:
April 10, 2018 / 12:24 AM / Updated an hour ago Samsung C&T shares rise after report of planned stake purchase in biopharma affiliate Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SEOUL (Reuters) - Shares in Samsung C&T Corp rose 3.6 percent on Tuesday after a report said the company is considering raising up to 3 trillion won (1.98 billion pounds) to buy a 30 percent stake in biopharma affiliate Samsung Bioepis Co Ltd. FILE PHOTO: Employees walk past a logo of Samsung C&T Corp at the company's headquarters in Seoul, South Korea, July 16, 2015. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji 
Samsung C&T has been contacting large financial institutions to raise the money, South Korean TV channel MBC reported on Monday, citing an unnamed person with knowledge of Samsungâ€™s process. 
Another affiliate, Samsung BioLogics Co Ltd, which owned 94.6 percent of Samsung Bioepis as of end-2017, saw its shares rise 6.8 percent in early trade. Reporting by Joyce Lee; Editing by Stephen Coates
